definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Do i need to provide additional medical form?
sentences.chinese: 我需要分外供给身子骨儿检查表吗？

sentences.english: Birth control pills made her fat and sick, she said.
sentences.chinese: 她说，服用避孕药让她变胖，身子骨变差。

sentences.english: Who would want to go see that bonny body of yours anyway?
sentences.chinese: 就你这柴禾妞的身子骨谁看你哪？

sentences.english: He that body bone canned be not young.
sentences.chinese: 他那身子骨可不年轻了。

definition: erhua variant of 身板[shen1 ban3]
weary old body (colloquial term, used jocularly or irreverently)
too weak to stand up to the wind (idiom); extremely delicate/fragile state of health
looking or feeling sickly/weak and dispirited through illness
unfit for anything/no good/useless/(of a sick person) beyond hope
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
polite term for old woman or man
to be able to endure (exertion, fatigue etc)/to be able to afford
